text:
e="preserve">Stacy Title (February 21, 1964 – January 11, 2021) was an American movie director, screenwriter and producer. She was known for directing and writing the horror/black comedy movies "Let the Devil Wear Black" (1999), "The Last Supper" (1995) and "The Bye Bye Man" (2017). Title was raised in New York state.
In December 2017, Title was diagnosed with ALS. She died from problems caused by the disease on January 11, 2021 at the age of 56.
